text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Extension 0..*ExtensionExtension
extension:productOrServiceCode 0..1ExtensionExtension
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"productOrServiceCode"
value[x] 0..1(Slice Definition)Value of extension
Slice: Unordered, Open by type:$this
valueCodeableConcept 0..1CodeableConceptValue of extension
Binding: X12 278 Requested Service Type (required)
extension-productOrServiceCodeEnd 0..1CodeableConceptExtension
URL: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/davinci-pas/StructureDefinition/extension-productOrServiceCodeEnd
Binding: X12 278 Requested Service Type (required)
extension:modifier 0..1ExtensionExtension
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"modifier"
value[x] 0..1(Slice Definition)Value of extension
Slice: Unordered, Open by type:$this
valueCodeableConcept 0..1CodeableConceptValue of extension
Binding: X12 278 Requested Service Type (required)
extension:unitPrice 0..1ExtensionExtension
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"unitPrice"
value[x] 0..1MoneyValue of extension
extension:quantity 0..1ExtensionExtension
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"quantity"
value[x] 0..1SimpleQuantityA fixed quantity (no comparator)
extension-epsdtIndicator 0..1booleanExtension
URL: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/davinci-pas/StructureDefinition/extension-epsdtIndicator
extension-nursingHomeLevelOfCare 0..1CodeableConceptExtension
URL: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/davinci-pas/StructureDefinition/extension-nursingHomeLevelOfCare
Binding: https://valueset.x12.org/x217/005010/request/2000F/SV1/1/20/00/1337 (required): Codes specifying the level of care provided by a nursing home facility. These codes are listed within an X12 implementation guide (TR3) and maintained by X12. All X12 work products are copyrighted. See their website for licensing terms and conditions.

extension:revenue 0..1ExtensionExtension
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"revenue"
value[x] 0..1(Slice Definition)Value of extension
Slice: Unordered, Open by type:$this
valueCodeableConcept 0..1CodeableConceptValue of extension
Binding: AHA NUBC Revenue Value Set (required)
extension-revenueUnitRateLimit 0..1decimalExtension
URL: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/davinci-pas/StructureDefinition/extension-revenueUnitRateLimit
extension-requestedService 0..1Reference(PAS Medication Request | PAS Service Request | PAS Device Request)Extension
URL: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/davinci-pas/StructureDefinition/extension-requestedService
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/us/davinci-pas/StructureDefinition/extension-itemAuthorizedDetail"
value[x] 0..0

Documentation for this format

name: AuthorizedItemDetail
publisher: HL7 International - Financial Management Work Group

contact.name: HL7 International - Financial Management Work Group

description: The details of what has been authorized for this item if different from what was requested.

element.definition: An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html) for a list).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The comparator is not used on a SimpleQuantity
element.comment: The context of use may frequently define what kind of quantity this is and therefore what kind of units can be used. The context of use may also restrict the values for the comparator.

The comparator is not used on a SimpleQuantity
